reviewText: I've been playing the Battlefield series since 1942. The game of course, not the year. I purchased this after knowing it isn't the same battlefield most of us know. Maps are smaller(thanks consolitis, the disease thats killing pc gaming) but surprisingly it totally works for this style of game. You really can't compare this to the COD series as its on its own. This is more of a close quarter combat game but not restrictive like the cod series thanks to the elements that make bf games what they are... awesome. Vehicles and Destruction equals beautiful. Anyone who was let down by the hyped up Mw2 multiplayer circus will find refuge here. The multiplayer is balanced. Its team based. So make sure you have your mic plugged in as communication is key. The sound quality is amazing. The game runs smooth on a decent machine. Just so you know though, you can make this run on some single core systems (set everything to low in the config file).. it isn't pretty, but it does work. I tested it out in eyefinity running a 5970 with intels new 6 core cpu.. not that the 6 core cpu was needed, but the system was powerful. Eyefinity gives this game a whole new level of enjoyable play. Then I tested 3d out on my nvidia powered rig. Freaking awesome. If you have the hardware you need this game. Just remember its totally different than bf2.. no prone.. no crazy large maps.. but it works, and it works well.Anyway point is.. it has the pace of cod, with the greatness of BF2.
summary: Perfect mix of Bf2 and Cod style play

reviewText: Ok, so I'm a big fps fan and maybe not the greatest player, but here's some things I think the programmers and company should have thought of:1)  What's the point of having a "KILL CAM"(camera)after you get killed, if it doesn't show how you got killed, but instead shows your opponent just running around after the fact.  It's a big waste of game playing time in my opinion...2)  Why not sell a "Prima" guide for this game the public could buy for say $20.00 bucks, instead of the $130.00 dollar guide only 8 people can buy.  Seems to me they could have made alot of money with the former.3)  Good size maps but only 32 player max???..  Which makes it difficult to mount a defense (conquest) because this game is all designed around flanking your opponents.  Which brings me to another point.  Why have a sniper class?  The game doesn't allow you to go prone, and you have to hold down the "crouch" button to stay crouched.  Having been a 2142 player for years, with larger maps and more players I found these issues to be extremely gay!4)  Now I like realism in the game, but this game was SOOO.. Freaking Bouncy I was getting headaches and I had to turn down the pitch and yaw in "video options" All the way, just to normalize the game enough to make it playable.5)  I'm not sure what "Autobalance" is for, because every map I go to in multi-player the teams are ALWAYS LOP-SIDED! And not just a little, I mean usally I enter a server and the weakest team is getting HAMMERED!  I can't count how many times I've gotten killed as soon as I spawned.6) Back to the sniper class: it would be nice if your weapons (rifles) actually did some damage. With reloading time, and with the game designed for only agressive flanking play, I run around with my knife and get more kills.7) I've got good video and sound, yet I had to turn my video to the low setting cause the game was too choppy, and the sound of the voices in the missions go in and out in volume no matter what I have the sound options set to.8)  The single player missions are not as good as MW2's, + ie no buddy-ing up in the missions.Ok, enough bitching now SOME GOOD POINTS:With all it's flaws the multi-player part of the game is better than MW2, just because you can actually kill anyone, and it's not a Wall Hack ORAMA...-->like MW2. Having PunkBuster/Evenbalance in this game makes a huge difference!  There's just Too Many Noobs out there that want to pad their stats by hacking or glitching, which of course ruins the game.It's a fun game, however it makes me wonder what EA and IW were actually thinking when they created this next generation in fps's.  With all the new stuff I have to ask are any of these guys/creators fps gamers?If you were wondering which game to buy..  MW2 or BC2, buyem both. That way you can have what the designers should have given us after SOOO MANY releases.Just Buy This One First.
summary: So much effort to create this game, but are the programmers gamers?

reviewText: Well, this review is going to be focused on those that are either new to the game or have yet to buy it. This game is bad! Very Bad! And I mean that in a good way. It is so fun to play!Update* I have been playing this game exclusively for six months now. It still has just as much fun (if not more) from day one. BUY NEW FOR V.I.P. code for free map pack downloads. If buying new...buy the 'Ultimate version' Learn to play on the normal maps first. Remember, if you are new, remember others have been playing this game for a LONG while, they most likely have all the weapons unlocked. There is a weapons 'add-on' pack to unlock ALL weapons you can buy from the EA store. it is $15... may be worth it for you.If you decide not to, remember, if you see someone die, PICK UP THEIR WEAPON pack... it is probably better than yours. If they are a medic, REVIVE the player who died after you pick up their pack, especially if you are the 'attacking' team.I own all the MW games and Halo games and the BC games.I have two gaming PCs, a Wii, XBOXs consoles, and now a PS3.I decided to buy this for my PS3 a couple months back ( I own only a handful of games for my PS3) after reading the reviews on it about the importance of team play and the incredible surround sound you can get from your home theatre system.This game is not MW2, the controls are way different and involve some-what of a learning curve, and the game play quite different than just running around killing as many people as you can.The single player portion of the game is okay. I still like it but the old BF are better, even the Halo series, MWs, or Half-Life's are noticeably better.But I am sure those that buy this game are buying it for the multiplayer experience. And this is where it separates itself from the rest!!!Leveling up is all about being a team player! You can loss a match, and still gain alot of experience points and possibly level up because you helped your team-mates. This game is more of a war-chess game. You have to know what piece you are going to be during a re-spawn depending on your team-mates skill level and what your team is trying to accomplish.Now, one thing I must say is this game is an ADULT GAME! PERIOD! The F bomb is frequently dropped during play even during multiplayer via the computer and not necessarily by online players though that can and does happen too. The game can be set to turn off some of the colorful character comments... but it is still not full proof and VERY LIMTED and difficult to do, you'll lose team-help message cues like "need ammo" "I need a medic" etc. It is ashamed the DICE game developers could not have made that an option in the game. It could have been easily added to the programming code.WHAT IS IMPORTANT FOR THIS GAME...or any team-based FPS, is to GET YOURSELF A GOOD CHAT MIKE-HEADPHONE combo unit like a Turtle Beach PX21 which will set you back about eighty George Washingtons! Playing with a mike and headphones is a must for ANY SERIOUS gamer. It is amazing how many people STILL do not use mikes with their PS3s. Now, a PS3 is more likely in the hands of adults. They buy it for the blue-ray -home theatre- gaming all-in-one compatibility. But being able to communicate with your squad is a must. Those teams that have good communications will win every time very simply. I'll write more of this later. A headset/mike combo prevents your team mates hearing your sound system via your chat mike which is VERY un-cool and annoying! If you can not communicate with your squad, this game will tend to get frustrating at times because you'll see your squad about to do something that you know will hurt your team, but have no way of warning them.I am a 40ish guy that still remembers the old 300 baud modems, Quake-I days of FPSs and the three-grand PC game systems! Well, let's start first at the graphics... I'll start and say they are a step below MW2... The frame rate is 30 FPS verses MW2 60 FPS. That being said, there is a massive amount of more information needing to be transmitted for BC2 verses MW2 because of the massive map sizes and the constant map changes due to environmental destruction, far away player locations, etc, if you understand packets and networking you'll understand why they limit the game to 30 FPS). That being said, the graphics still are amazing for a console system! ( Nothing beats a great gaming PC; but most people can not afford a 2k gaming system though)Now for the sound... the surround sound is literally AMAZING! The sound beats any game hands down. Explosions rock the house on my home theatre system. You can hear bullets wiz by your ears, and screams in the distance. That being said, this game is NOT for kids or young teens strictly for the language. F bombs are very common and are the very way it would be if you were in a real combat situation. These can be limited via the menu, but obvious are still in the multiplayer chat mode where real players talk real trash!!! The language tends to be much better than XBOX360 online community just because the game community is simply 'older' and more mature in the PS3 community!The sound of Tanks and Jets and Helicopter rumble the whole house. SCARY! I'm thinking you could get a case of "post traumatic stress sydrome" from playing this game. The Surround sound sounds just like you are there and seems to come from just where it is happening like in real life... if the sound is to your right far away it sounds it too! Bullets even echo and ricochet sound inside metal structures. You can even hear flesh wounds from bullets and the screams of combat victims.Not enough can be said about the destructible environments. You need go to youtube videos of game play. Destructible environments truly change the whole game play every time you play. Forest can be leveled to the ground. Entire building can be collapsed on your enemies killing everyone inside.You can get in a three story build and take some C4 and blew a wall out without windows to be able to spot enemies as a Recon class.Now, one thing I dislike about the game is the lack of custom programming of button layouts. You can not choose what buttons do what. There are some pre-programmed changes you can do but they are VERY limited.The other thing that is a negative is the networking, not the game networking, but the PS3. No LAN party support either! HUGE mistake on Dice's part! If you want to play, you all must get online and join a BC2 server to play.Now granted, the networking is free with the PS3, which I like a lot. I have had only a few games that have booted me off. I would like to be able to choose what game I play depending on the `pings', which there is no way of knowing this via the game. All said ... the networking is far better than I ever expected. The other thing is this game does not allow two players to play through one game system. That is where MW2 and Halo shine when you have friends over. LAN SUPPORT should have been there!Now on game play... TEAM WORK is a MUST! A GOOD Mike/headset is a must!Remember... this game has a more realistic bullet curves due to gravity and a time delay hitting the target over long distance shooting involving a learning curve. Leveling up to gain the 12x Milli-dot scope is a must! And shooting ahead of running targets is important over long ranges.There are four classes: Assault, Engineer, Medic and Recon Class. Each has its own weaknesses and strengths depending on your team-mates skills and what type of game is being played, team-DM, conquest, rush, etc. I play mostly the "Rush" mode. Now Rush-mode is where there are two teams, `attackers' and `defenders'. "Defenders" have unlimited re-spawn lives, where the "Attackers" get 75 re-spawn lives total for all players to accomplish their goal of blowing up two-of six total communication cases marked `A' and `B'. Don't just get yourself killed guys if you are attackers! If you accomplish this then the re-spawn limit for attackers resets to 75, if your team runs out of re-spawn lives before this, you lose. Now if you do this for each pair of three missions, your attacking team wins.If you are new, remember spotting and tagging enemies is a must via your `select' button, even before shooting them. An orange triangle tags that enemy player for about 5 seconds. This tells other team-mates where the enemy is in force. Often a player will sneak into your base, and wait for re-spawning players to re-spawn on their hiding position. Than after re-enforcements arrive they'll squad attack. If you spawn at someone's position. Don't stand beside them, find a spot about 15 paces or more away. Too easy to gernade-launch the two of you otherwise.Now, recon is a good class is you are patient. Most people will `sniper' attack and fire on the enemy... which does nothing for an `Attacking' team-player. Kills are important if you are a Defender team-player. If you are a recon (sniper)...remember, one shot-one kill, that means HEAD SHOTS! You want to get the attacking team from 75 to 0 as quickly as possible to win the match. Setting four C4 three times on a communication case will destroy also.Medics can bring teammates back from the dead. Gaining 80 points each time they heal a team mate. Medics and Assault class also have very powerful machine guns.When you die, the player who killed you is seen via third-person position which gives a general idea where they were at but not in 'hardcore' mode.This game is very fun. You can drive ATVs, Tanks, Humvees, Jet-skis, Motor boats, and Helicopters, and RC drones. The sound will knock your socks off! I have put all my other games down since I begun to play this game. There is nothing like loading up a drone with C4 and flying it into a group of your enemies and setting it off. If you want to get away from games that just have you running around and killing everyone you can, this game is for you.Remember, MICROPHONE IS A MUST, use your cell-phone bluetooth headset if you have to at least; Headphone-mic (turtlebeach 21) combo is best that way your teammates do not hear your sound system through your mike (Which is way annoying and distracting)!
summary: Very bad game!  In a good way!

My father is a seaman. I have seen many ships, sailed with him around the world numerous times. So ships are in my blood. When i saw this game I bought it without batting an eyelid. Well I wish I didn't because I now regret my decision.The game is unique in its concept. We never really had a maritime ship simulation that wasn't centrally focused on war and sinking other ships :). This one happens to be just peace-time shipping simulation with different kinds of detailed ships ranging from cargo, to passenger, to rescues, to towing, to even trying to alter history by succesfully sailing Titanic to New york on its first maiden voyage etc. The game creator has gone to great details to simulate as much as possible the Intricacies of piloting as well as managing huge ships operations. Any aspiring sea captian or sea salt will identify with some if not most aspects of piloting a ship as simulated in this game. But to me thats where all the goodies end.The cons associated with game are just too game-breaking to me and i have essentially stopped playing the game. Until these issues gets addressed i am not spending anymore money on this games series.First and foremost this game badly needs a voluntary "Time Compression" feature. Not all of us have 2-3 hours to devote each time we decide to play this game to have some fun. Sometimes it take an hour or so just to get out of harbour and tag some hours more on this to complete the mission. With a game in which you are looking at ocean waves for hours this gets boring really fast. This is just plain very annoying and game destroying factor to me. I know some people have all the time in the world to savour and enjoy games but a lot dont too. Since its not a action oriented game the passage of time is felt even more. If they can incorporate a Time Compression feature it will make the game lot more open to different segments of gamers.Second is the still dated graphics engine. I see lots of people commenting on how good the graphics look. I have a pretty good rig and i can play games like Mass Effect and Silent Hunter 4 in almost thearatical quality but even with everything maxed out this game just looks medicore graphics wise. The ships and ocean etc. looks very simplistically rendered from today's standard. The graphical quality of this game released in 2008 is kind of dissappointing though.Last some of the missions in the game are just plain novice or fillers in my opinion. This game is geared towards people who like to pilot huge ships yet we have a lot of missions devoted to speed boats for stunts, hover boats etc. I bought the game to simulate a ship expirience not go around flipping in speed boats.Anyways..i wouldn't really recommend anyone spend $40 bucks on this game. Wait until it gets to $19 or so bargain bin. And i hope the developers put some real effort into make a more viable ship simluator for its next incarnation or you are not getting any more money from me.
summary: Great concept but equally flawed game....

While this game is fun to play it has severe limitations.  If you are looking to captain a ship from Point A to Point B on a global cruise this game will not do it for you.  There are only about 15 or 20 harbors around the globe for you to sail and they are not connected.  So if you want to go from New York to London forget it because in the game there is nothing between the two.  Additionally, the graphics on this game are about ten years behind the high end games sold today.  Also, while the cover artwork of this game deceptively resembles MS Flight Simulator's cover artwork, MS has NOTHING to do with this product. Do not expect a start to finish trip in this game like you have in any of the MS Flight Simulator versions.  You are basically limited to sailing an ocean liner, tanker, or cruise and cargo ships up and down some harbor like New York.  The missions prove to be the bright spot in this game.  They are fun and interactive.  But once you work your way through the missions there is nothing more the game will offer.  Unlike MS Flight Simulator where player created trips are limitless, once the missions are complete in Ship Simulator the game has nothing to offer.  The mouse and keyboard controls on the game are adequate but again there are quirks in the controls you won't find on high end games.  I would expect to find this game in the bargain bin at the local Wal-Mart for $4.99.

I waisted a whole month trying to figure this game out and my whole morning going across the seas only to crash the Russian Tug into the Agile Solutions Freighter that I tried to tow from getting stranded on a dock from a game glitch...I am so glad that it was free off my Amazon gift card that I recieved for Christmas. Ship Simulator is a decent product for a light-hearted simulation of powered ships. Using it, you can become the captain of a number of different vessels, including a supertanker, rescue vessel, various powerboats, and even the Titanic. Several world class harbors are accurately reproduced with realistic scenery and other boat traffic. The physics of powered boats are reasonably well done. A large number of missions take you from novice to expert ship driver.There are no sailboats, alas, and the controls can be twitchy at high speeds. There is full support for keyboard, mouse, and joystick controls, and camera angles can be varied at will.
summary: Ship Simulator for the Nautically Obsessed

This has to be the best thing I have invested in for my Xbox gameplay.  I ordered this quite afraid that the product I was going to receive was going to match the price I paid for it and that it would not work at all! I have never been so wrong... As soon as I slipped the extremely easy silicone case over my controller I noticed a big difference. The A,B,X,and Y buttons were noticeably lower to the controller before. This instantly turned me off of the case because I thought it would lessen my ability to press these buttons. As soon as I started playing borderlands 2 everything changed, I could no longer feel the difference between the button height and instantly my horrible gaming palms (my palms get quite sweaty when gaming) started to sweat up the controller. I noticed the silicone, unlike the controller, did not slip move from my grip, somehow it let the moisture from my hands evaporate and my sweaty palms were continuing to play the game effortlessly. About 2 hours through the best gaming session of my Xbox carrier, I noticed I hadn't slipped, moved, or wiped my palms once! This is such an amazing product and I just now bought 2 more for my friends to use. I cannot believe that such an amazing product could be sold for such a small amount of money, if you play xbox and do not have this case, you are seriously missing out and need to buy this right now!

reviewText: Must have upgrade for your controller. Fits like a glove, has a good color and just the right amount of friction for those sweaty hands. It is inexpensive, buy one today. I recommend it!

No biggie though, finished in a couple minutes and I was ready to get back on CoD/Halo and kick some ***!

This is not the first one of these I have had, in fact this is about my 8th. There are many different skin types and different skin makers, so you have to judge each on it's own merit. My controller skin arrived today, well ahead of expected delivery, just as described solid black and silicone. Fit is just perfect, and installation had no problems. Good comfortable smooth texture, while still providing a much better grip than on the hard slick controller plastic. I like to clean my game equipent regularly, and I always clean even new items before using. This is a great way to test the quality of the item, I cleaned the skin using isopropanal alchohol, no gumming (like you get with lower grade skins)and no color bleed onto the rag, this tells me it is definitly silicone not some rubber stuff. Once on the controller grip is good, comfort is good, feel is natural. I am very pleased with this controller skin, I have been needing to get one for my extra controller. I will definitly be ordering a few more later, a friend has a birthday coming up.
Great protection and grip for a while, but like a latex glove, it stretches out after a little time.  For the price, a great deal.

I bought two of these for two of my Xbox 360 controllers, and I'm certainly glad I did. They look great, reduce the buildup of dead skin cells in the grooves around the controller (which always bothers me), provide grip and comfort. I can't say these will improve your gaming skills, but they certainly don't hurt them.I was concerned that they might get in the way of my KontrolFreeks: FPS Freeks VIPR stick extensions, but they are just fine and require no modification. They fit the controller quite snugly, and provide just a small bit of cushion for your hands.The excess silicone seam around the skin from the molding process is just the slightest bit more uncomfortable than the groove that is already in the controller, but this is easily remedied with a hobby knife blade (X-acto). Just carefully trim off the excess material until it's smooth and then enjoy the comfort!I have more controllers and plan to buy more skins for ALL of them!
summary: Grip, Comfort, Protection, Aesthetics... Overall Great Product!

This skin looks good, has a great grip and is very comfortable for game playing but I soon found an unfortunate and irritating unexpected flaw - the silicone attracts pet hair like crazy.  We have a couple cats and if you're a pet owner as well you'll know that it's almost impossible to keep those follicles from sticking to your furniture and clothes in some way.  With that in mind, when I opened the plastic packaging and merely set the skin on my dresser to pick up the controller, it had already attracted a nice array of cat hair when I came back to put it on.  Granted it was a small amount but since the silicone is rubberized it made removing the hair a real pain as compared to the controller's regular plastic finish which doesn't seem to act as a hair magnet and can be easily wiped clean with a tissue or paper towel. It's not a deal-breaker and I'd still definitely recommend the product but for pet owners with animals that shed, be forewarned about this inconvenience.
summary: Great comfort but doesn't stop attracting pet hair

Yes, you do actually get FOUR separate 16-slot cartridge holders. Games pop into and out of the slots inside them very smoothly, though the external box clasp is very tightly secured, almost difficultly so if you don't have any nails.The color choices are cute, and since all four of them together hold a total of 64 DS games, menfolk can safely gift the pink one to a lady friend to avoid getting beat up for having a pink cartridge holder.
summary: Useful for those with far too many loose DS games

reviewText: Although the cases open and close a bit difficult these work great for all my husband's DSi Games.  It also helps because the kids cannot open them easily so his games don't get lost if they do get their hands  on the case.

This really beats lugging around those game cases your games came in and you can carry so many more in less space. I already had some of these that only hold six games, I really bought these for a present. I know she will love them.

The tab that closes the cases is sometmes hard to open.  The little closure fasteners that keep it closed have snapped off.  There are two on each over half of the cases have lost one.  The cases still stay closed. I am just waiting for the other one to fall off and then the case will not stay closed.  The games fit nice inside but some do not hold the games as tight as I thought.  I think these cases would be better for SD cards.  I adjust the tabs that hold the game so they stay in tighter.  Younger kids may have a harder time getting games in and out and opening the case.  The only thing I like about it is it is compact and holds alot of games.
summary: DS Cartridge Organizer Game Card Case 16 (4 pack)

reviewText: what a great bargain on cases.  now all 4 of my kids will have their own game case, to hold all of their games.  best deal around.

Love the holder! Each holder has slots for 16 games. Very compact. It's only about a 4 inch square and about 1 inch thick. Best thing I ever bought to house all my kids games. They snap in and out easily. Great organizer to make sure all the games get put back when not in use.

This 4-pack of DS game cases is a bargain if you are looking for inexpensive storage and portability for lots of DS games -HOWEVER- the quality of the cases matches the price.  Each case can hold 16 games.  Slightly smaller in dimensions than the 16 slot cases made by HORI and branded by Nintendo DS, the plastic of these cases is thinner, not as durable, and the cases are hard to open and pages difficult to turn.  The outer tabs which hold the case closed broke on two cases the first time I tried to open them (clear and pink) and one of the pages (blue case) snapped off at the hinged tab when trying to turn it and came completely out of the case.  I'm going back to the DS branded cases, and these cases are headed to the recycle bin!

Big waste of money not worth the effort to even send them back - poor construction the tabs are hard to open and then either close toooo tight that you have to struggle to open them or you break them when opening them - JUNK !
summary: Waste of money too hard to open and tabs break

reviewText: I bought these over the summer for my girls.  It held all of their games well, but some of the slots are alittle bigger then others and the games kept falling out.  Otherwise, its a great holder for the price!

I got these for my kids for xmas so we will see how long they last. I think if they were easier to open then I would be alot happier.

I absolutely love these.  I have several different kinds of game cases now.  These are far superior in my opinion.  I find most cases a little tight to open.  But most others have the games pop out if you are not careful, which can be a problem on a plane or even in a car between the seats.  There are 4 pages that hold 4 games front and back of each.  Each page securely hold each game with plastic tabs that are easy to insert into and remove from.  There is no reasonable chance of the games coming lose.  The hard shell protects them very well.  It is a very compact way to hold 16 games.  I prefer these over any of my other cases for bulk storage.As compact as it is, it still is a bit much to fit into a small carry case with your XL unless you have a larger bag.  So what I do is use a smaller 3-game case or thicker 8-game case but still thinner than this which fit easily into my XL carry case depending on which I use.  I really don't need 16 available on the go.  So I primarily use this to tote backup games when I am not sure which I want to take with me on a trip, or to simply store games that don't have a case of their own because I bought them used.This 4 pack is such a good value if still reasonably priced.  I had no problem with delivery, construction, or defects.  They even came with a nice friendly note.  Compare this to a single 16-game case that costs nearly as much as this 4-pack.

i have to use these, once i used one a few years ago i cant use a normal controller.be careful putting it on and your good to go.the only thing is i ordered ORANGE and got "YELLOW!!".was mad at first then i realized i dont own anything that is yellow.nothing.and i lose my controller quite often!but now i just stand up spin in a circle and the first glimpse of yellow i see bam! my  hiding controller, something to think about when you choose your color more uses than just preference.other than the mixup these are awsome you dont sweat and great grip.like the other reviewer said if you play more than 3 hours a day these are essential.
summary: good product but got the wrong color no biggie tho

reviewText: I have been using this product for almost 2 months and I absolutely love it.  I always had a problem with dead skin getting stuck in the side crevices of the controller for some reason so I would have to clean it out once a week.  My hands also got really sweaty while playing with the original controller for a long time.This product solved both problems.  My hands stay very dry when I use the case and I no longer have to clean off my controller.  The case also provides extra grip and padding for long gaming sessions.  My only complaint is that the case feels flimsy/like it is going to snap at points when I put it on or take it off the controller.  So I don't recommend taking it on and off to excess.In summary I would recommend you buy this product if you play games for more than 3 hours a week.(In case I wasn't clear enough.)ProsConfortable material gives extra paddingMaterial gives extra grip while holding controllerKeeps hands dryConsFeels cheap when trying to put in on or take it off
Didnt fit my wireless controller so i gave it to my cousin. It fit his sony controller perfectly.

Its awesome, it fits the controller, if your favorite color is blue, don't waste time n get it NOW. it might get torn after sometime but i bet it wont if u take care of it.I bought one and m getting the other one right NOW. peace.
This was purchased as a gift for my son. It was on his wish list so I got it for him. He is happy with it.

It fits right, but it doesn't feel right. It feels almost greasy, and the rubber edges end where your fingertips are and will bother you a lot. In my opinion, it doesn't look very nice either, and not worth the $5. (shipping)

I bought these for our Wii remotes and they are too long.  Seems like they are made to fit the Wii remote with the motion sensor adapter.  We have original Wii remotes without the adapter and then newly purchased Wii remotes with the motion sensor built in and these skins did not fit either of those remotes. Too bad as quality seems good and colors were great.
The Skins work very well with an original Wii controller and MotionPlus adapter attached to the bottom. They feel good in the hand and they are comfortable to use. A great product overall.

These cases are EXACTLY like the clear ones that come with the Wii Motion Plus Remotes...only colored.  The blue and pink match the colored remotes perfectly and I like to use them to color coordinate with certain games that are color coordinated by player.
I was looking for a small docking station for our PS3 Move controllers but didn't want to pay a lot. I saw this one and it does exactly what I need it to at a low price.

I thought I would be able to charge all 4 of my Playstation Move wands, however the ports are sized so that you can charge two and their companion controllers. Works well, just not what I had expected.
summary: Charges 2!!!!!!!! wands plus those other things...

reviewText: Price was good but the item is usb. If you have an AC adapter for USB charging - you should be good to go. Otherwise you can only charge while the PS3 is on...
Our kid loves these PS3 accessories as he's able to use them extensively with the Sports Champions game.  I would definitely recommend PEGA as a seller!

This bundle was a great deal that is fun to use with a multitude of different PS3 Move games. They are very lightweight and seem flimsy; however, they have held up to the rigor of my teenage son and his friends. So, they are certainly serving their purpose! The Move controller fits into each one perfectly, which is great...no need to have to work hard to put the controllers in or take the controllers out! None of the controllers have ever come loose either. I wish the material for this bundle was a bit more durable-feeling, but the lightweight design does make them very easy to uses for kids, women and guys alike!

This is an excellent aluminum protective case for $15, comparing to the crap I find at Best Buy for much higher price. After four months of use, the case still hold up. It took serious abuse with plenty of scratches and scuff marks. The DSi XL is well protected.The protective screen is useless. It scratches too easily, but this is the same with protective screens from other vendors. My kid end up get rid of the protective screen altogether. Overall, the case does it job very well at a very good price.

reviewerName: c joy "book lover/ dual android/apple user"
reviewText: I have been looking for a hard shell case for the ds xl for some time and I finally found this one on amazon.The case fits snugly and has openings for all the ports and buttons.Screen protectors and a cleaning cloth were included. Also there was a small gift card which could be used if this was a gift..kinda cute, a nice touch. Anyway this will definitly protect my ds from scratches and fingerprint smudges.

It is sturdy, but not bulky. It protects my sons new DSi XL from scratches and the occasional fumble.(thank goodness) It's also a pleasing color. When I read it was the color  rose red I was a bit worried it'd be on the pink side. Thankfully it isn't and is closer to a ruby red in my opinion. All in all, it does what it's supposed to making it a great item!
summary: It does what it is ment to!

reviewText: This is a beautiful case the color is nice except that the case is not a aluminum it is hard plastic. Overall seems like a good product.

I bought this item because it was a great deal for both the case and the screen protector .  I removed my original screen protector that originally came with the dsi xl to replace it with the one I bought here, only to find that it didn't fit!  They gave me two screen protectors that are the same size.  The top screen however is much bigger than the bottom so it was too small.  What was worse was that it was too big for the bottom screen!  I had to use scissors to trim the edge so that it would lay flat.  I was highly disappointed that the screen protector did not fit the top nor the bottom screens.  In the end, I went ahead and paid extra to buy the screen protectors at the store where I knew it would fit.The case is not bad for the price. I wouldn't buy this if you were intending to have screen protectors that fit though.
summary: Case is good, protective covers don't fit
